title: Manhunt for two brothers over UK cargo truck deaths
text:
A manhunt is underway in the UK for two brothers police believe are connected to the 39 people found dead in a refrigerated cargo truck in England last week.

Police are searching for Ronan and Christopher Hughes from Northern Ireland on suspicion of manslaughter and human trafficking.

They say the brothers are thought to be somewhere in their home country - but that they also have links to the Republic of Ireland.

The driver of the truck, Maurice Robinson also from Northern Ireland, appeared in court on Monday (October 28) accused of manslaughter, money laundering, conspiracy to traffic people and conspiracy to assist unlawful immigration.
description:
A manhunt is underway in the UK for two brothers police believe are connected to the 39 people found dead in a refrigerated cargo truck in England last week. 
              Police are searching for Ronan and Christopher Hughes from Northern Ireland on suspicion of manslaughter and human trafficking. 
              They say the brothers are thought to be somewhere in their home country - but that they also have links to the Republic of Ireland. 
              The driver of the truck, Maurice Robinson also from Northern Ireland, appeared in court on Monday (October 28) accused of manslaughter, money laundering, conspiracy to traffic people and conspiracy to assist unlawful immigration.
